Matt Sielski

Metuchen, New Jersey

Quote

"Nothing is more fun than taking an obscure set of data, cleaning it up, and making it useful in ways no one saw before."

About Permalink

Things Matt has been doing

  • Building modern technology systems to promote scientific progress for the public good
  • Supporting the advancement of human-focused communications technology
  • Using Drupal to replace paper-based processes at academic conferences
  • Volunteering as an EMT and EMS building manager for his civic-minded community
  • Advocating for pedestrian safety through digital data mapping
  • Backpacking Deep Creek Canyon into Zion National Park
  • Watering his lawn using an Arduino, relays, and some custom code

Fun facts about Matt

  • Learned programming in elementary school to try to make the family computer do more things
  • Has a BS in Computer Science and minor in Cognitive Science from Rutgers University
  • Gets a break from the screen by woodworking, 3D printing, and tinkering
  • Enjoys small-town life with his wife, two small kids, and a dog (plus some robots)

Personal pronouns

he/him

Role

Engineering

  • Engineering
